course_outcomes.description: Understand the concepts of data structures and algorithms.
Analyze the efficiency of algorithms using time and space complexity.
Apply linear and non-linear data structures to solve problems.
Evaluate sorting and searching algorithms for various applications.
Design algorithms using dynamic programming and greedy approaches.

topics: Arrays and Linked Lists - Single Linked List

learning_outcomes.description: Explain the operations of arrays and linked lists.
Implement stacks and queues for given applications.

topics: Binary Trees - Binary Search Trees (BST) Operations and Traversals

learning_outcomes.description: Construct binary search trees from given data.
Compare BFS and DFS traversal methods.

topics: Quick Sort - Merge Sort - Heap Sort

learning_outcomes.description: Analyze the time complexity of Quick Sort and Merge Sort.
Apply hashing techniques to store and retrieve data efficiently.

topics: Greedy Algorithms: Activity Selection Problem & Huffman Coding

learning_outcomes.description: Solve the Knapsack problem using Dynamic Programming.
Design efficient algorithms using Greedy approach.

topics: Shortest Path Algorithms - Dijkstra's & Bellman-Ford Algorithm; Minimum Spanning Trees - Prim's and Kruskal’s algorithms

learning_outcomes.description: Apply Dijkstra's algorithm to find shortest paths.
Analyze the complexity of Prim's and Kruskal’s algorithms.
